intro: Centaurium centaurioides subsp. malzacianum, commonly known as the Malzac's centaury, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Gentianaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces blue to violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in grasslands and along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
